intro: Brossaea candida, commonly known as the white-flowered brossaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Brossaea candida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and unique appearance.
